results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Sequel Productions, Bill Gavin and Ian Mune
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: What are you running for? = Qusque tu vas de meme?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Francois Seguillon and Jacques Bobet
results.brief_description: The running of the Fernand Grenier Race, an annual 67 kilometer relay foot race between the villages of La Guadeloupe and Lac Megantic, Quebec, during the first weeked in October. Competitors come from all parts of the province to run in the five-hour marathon. This film covers the entire race, often employing multi-image techniques to show more than one runner at a time. The film has no commentary.

results.title: What are words worth: copyright, CAL & sampling
results.creator_credit: Serious Business TV Production, Copyright Agency Ltd and Barry Jacobs
results.brief_description: The purpose of copyright is to protect the intellectual property of writers thus ensuring they are given the renumeration to which they are entitled. This program explains copyright issues such as the function of CAL and why it conducts copying surveys, the importance of copyright protection not only for authors but the whole community and the advantages of a centralised licensing and CAL sampling system. The program uses role play with actors to impart the important message about copyright.

results.title: What are we doing to our children? Part 2: welfare and the fatherless family
results.brief_description: Looks at the consequences of America’s Welfare system on young children. Daycare centers, unwed or working others, absentee fathers due to the welfare “man in the house” rule combine to inflict trauma on young children.

results.title: What are we doing to our children, locked up, locked out
results.brief_description: A poignant case history of a damaged, unstable family and a child’s resultant antisocial behavioral problems. Issues arising from this case are child advocacy in the courts and the rehabilitative effect of jailing juvenile delinquents. From the series CBS reports.

results.brief_description: Introduces some ideas relation to probability, and presents situations designed to explore random events and the frequency distribution of probability. From the series Vision in mathematics.

results.title: What are cells?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Living Cell”.
To introduce this film the concept of cellular organization of plants and animals is examined and the main parts of a cell are identified. The diversity of cells within a single organism is illustrated. A brief history of microscopy shows how improvements in instrument made possible the formulation of the cell theory. An animated sequence demonstrates the process of mitotic nuclear division in an animal cell and the film end s by showing the major differences between plant and animals cells.

group_siblings.title: The Role of the cell membrane

results.title: What am I bid for the tree?
results.creator_credit: Oldfield and Sons and Barrie Oldfield
results.brief_description: A satirical approach to the value of trees. Actor, James Bailey, by taking on various guises - teacher, philosopher, auctioneer, architect - tries to inform an uninterested audience of the many uses of the tree. Filmed at Wungong Brook, Western Australia - a film for Arbor Day. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: What about us
results.brief_description: The film shows a Swedish school class in which the children are all between nine and ten years old. The children give us their view on changes taking place in our environment.
